paper_abstract: Boolean matching is a fundamental problem in FPGA synthesis, but existing Boolean matchers are not scalable to complex PLBs (programmable logic blocks) and large circuits. This paper proposes a filter-based Boolean matching method, F-BM, which accelerates Boolean matching using lookup tables implemented by Bloom filters storing pre-calculated matching results. To show the effectiveness of the proposed F-BM, a post-mapping re-synthesis minimizing area which employs Boolean matching as the kernel has been implemented. Tested on a broad selection of benchmarks, the re-synthesizer using F-BM is 80X faster with 0.5% more area, compared with the one using a SAT-based Boolean matcher.
paper_title: Accelerating Boolean Matching Using Bloom Filter
